deck: Chris Henderson is a writer that has worked for Marvel Comics.
name: Chris Henderson

deck: Film Producer and President of the Vampirella Fan Club, The Scarlet Legion from 1995 to Present.
description:
Sean Fernald has fifteen years of major record label experience with MCA Records, Virgin Records, Capitol Records and Sony Music, specializing in visual marketing, music video (production and promotion) and music licensing for film.

Sean produced "Red Velvet" (a horror-fantasy film) and is now in active development with "Devil's Highway" (a highway chase thriller) and "Wasted Space" (a dark urban comedy with sci-fi elements).

Sean is a voting member of NARAS (National Association of Recording Arts and Sciences) going on 10 years now and has served as a consultant specializing in music, entertainment and conflict resolution (often times a good skill to have in the film industry!).
name: Sean Fernald

deck: Artist that worked in the 40s for Novelty Press and Marvel.
name: Fred Bell

deck: Writer who worked for Novelty Press and Marvel in the 40s.
name: Roy Garn

deck: He is a translator that has worked with Dark Horse.
name: Frederick L. Schodt

description:
Brian worked on a number of science-fiction titles, illustrating and painting cover art.

Best known for his work on 2000AD, Starlord and House Of Hammer.
name: Brian Lewis

description: UK illustrator (?), wrongly credited for illustrating MACH Zero in 2000AD.
name: Mike Donaldson

description: Scripted a single Future Shock for 2000AD (Fugitive in prog 66).
name: Philip Greenaway

description: Future Shock writer in 2000AD.
name: Jan Garczynski

description: Illustrated many British comics in the 1970's and 1980's including Ant Wars for 2000ad (later reprinted in Eagle) and Black Hawk (for Tornado).
name: Alfonso Azpiri

description: Luis Bermejo was born in Madrid, Spain in 1931.
name: Luis Bermejo

deck: Known best for his role as Luke Skywalker in Star Wars and voicing The Joker in the 90s Batman animated series. He co-wrote The Black Pearl, published by Dark Horse, and wrote an introduction to Batman: Riddler Two-Face, a TPB tie-in to Batman Forever. Predominantly he is a voice actor.
description:
Roles

Luke Skywalker:

  • Star Wars Episode IV A New Hope
  • Star Wars Episode V The Empire Strikes Back
  • Star Wars Episode VI Return of The Jedi
  • Star Wars Episode VII The Force Awakens
  • Star Wars Holiday Special (non-cannon)
  • Saturday Night Live (non-cannon)
  • Robot Chicken (non-canon)

Joker:

  • Batman The Animated Series
  • The New Batman Adventures
  • Superman The Animated Series: Static Shock, Justice League
  • Batman: Mask of The Phantasm
  • Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker
  • Birds of Prey TV series (voiced Joker, but didn't physically played him)
  • The Adventures of Batman and Robin video game (Sega CD version)
  • Batman Arkham Asylum Video Game
  • Robot Chicken (non-canon)
  • Tim Burton's Batman Special Edition DVD (in the DVD extras) (voice acting)
  • Batman Arkham City Video Game
  • Batman Arkham Knight Video Game
  • DC Universe Online Video Game

Other Voices:

  • Hobgoblin, a.k.a. Jason Phillip Macendale - Spider-Man The Animated Series (voice acting).
  • Solomon Grundy - Justice League, Justice League Unlimited (voice acting).
  • Boss Tony Zucco - The Batman (voice acting).
  • Fire Lord Ozai - Avatar: The Last Airbender (voice acting).
  • Gargoyle - The Incredible Hulk (voice acting).
  • Threshold - Gen13 (voice acting).
  • Maximus the Mad - The Fantastic Four Animated Series.
  • As Himself - 3rd Rock from the Sun, Just Shoot Me, Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, The Simpsons, Futurama Bender's Big Score, Robot Chicken.
  • Miss Swan's Father - MadTV.

Additional Comic book writing credits:

  • Wrote the introduction to Batman: Son of the Demon.
  • Wrote the introduction to Batman: Riddler/Two-Face.
  • Wrote a few stories for The Simpsons comic book for Bongo including a parody of the DC Comics story Crisis on Infinite Earths.
name: Mark Hamill

deck: British fantasy and science fiction author and editor.
name: Stan Nicholls

deck: Spanish artist who worked on British comics in the 1980s and 1990s.
description:
Real name Eduardo Vano Ibarra.

Has illustrated:

  • Death Wish (for three UK comics - Speed, before it merged with Tiger, and before that merged with Eagle)
  • Ghost Squad (for Eagle)
  • Judge Dredd (for 2000AD)
  • Mask of Evil (for Eagle)
  • Storm Force (for Battle and Eagle)
  • Turbo Jones (for Wildcat)
  • Wolfie Smith (for Tornado)
name: Vanyo

name: Geoffrey Miller

deck: Comic book artist who did pencils and inks. Was also an assistant editor.
description:
He worked on Captain Kid, Cowboy Cal, Monkey Doodles, li`l leaguer (1956-1959), Madge the badge (1978-1979).

He was also an assistant editor on Captain America, Lt. Hercules and Sam Stuper.
name: Al Liederman

deck: Son of comic writer Jeph Loeb.  Sam Loeb tragically died after battling cancer.
description:
His first and only written work was for an issue of Buffy the vampire slayer which was drawn up by his fathers frequent collabarater Tim sale
 

Dedication

 
Superman/Batman #26 was dedicated to Sam. It was created by a number of writers and artists, including his father Jeph Loeb, Tim Sale, Geoff Johns, John Cassaday and Joss Whedon. His father wrote a second story in the issue called Sam's Story. 
An episode of Smallville was dedicated to Sam's memory
name: Sam Loeb

deck: Amber Benson played Tara on the hit TV series Buffy the Vampire Slayer.  She co-wrote several Buffy comics about Willow and Tara.
name: Amber Benson

deck: Letterer for DC in the early 40s. Also worked for Prize and Mainline.
name: Howard Ferguson

deck: Artist whose work was published by Fiction House and Great Comics Publications in the late 30s.
name: Don DeConn

deck: Jones is an English comic book writer
description: Sebastian A. Jones is an English comic book writer and founder of Stranger Comics.
name: Sebastian Jones

description: I've been a professional artist for over 20 years, working for most of the major publishers in my native Sweden as well many international publishers, including Paizo Publishing, Mattel, and Penguin. I mostly do book covers, children's books and graphic novels. In 2011 I completed three graphic novels for IDW with Joe R. Lansdale, Richard Morgan and Alex Irvine writing. My own graphic novel The Portent has been published in nine languages and spawned an intellectual property containing the young adult series The Legend of Morwhayle, Realm of the Dead (De dödas rike), and a new graphic novel with characters from Morwhayle.
name: Peter Bergting

description: He designed the logo for Salvador.
name: Christopher Walmsley

description:

  • Harry Kipling (Deceased)
  • Judge Dredd

For Image he has illustrated:

  • Elephantmen
name: Boo Cook

story_arc_credits.name: A la vie, à la mort
The Road To Civil War II

deck: Editor and Chief Publisher of NOW Comics in the 80s and 90s.  NOW Comics published several comics including Speed Racer, The Real Ghostbusters, The Terminator, and Ralph Snart Adventures among others.
name: Tony Caputo

description:
Valerie was an editor for Acclaim and DC comics in titles such as Justice League and Identity Crisis.

After leaving DC Comics, she started a new angle in her career as a well-known blogger for Occasional Superheroine

As a writer, D'Orazio recently completed work on X-Men Origins: Emma Frost, Girl Comics, and PunisherMax: Butterfly.

She is the former President of Friends of Lulu.
name: Valerie D'Orazio
